website_summaries.verdict: Works very well to preserve your body heat in an emergency, as well as guard against wind and water.
pros: Available in Safety Orange or Tactical Green
Material is an ultra-lightweight HeatEcho reflective polyester film
Reflects 90% of your heat back to you
Tear-resistant, as well as wind and waterproof
cons: Make sure you keep your head (and breathing) out of it, as condensation easily builds up to puddle proportions
Some reports that the material here is very thin and rips easily

customer_reviews.title: Don’t put a sleeping bag in this
customer_reviews.text: Well I think I learned how NOT to use it so I will try again soon. I spent the night in the north Georgia mountains. Temperature dropped to low 40s. No tent just these bivvys and a tarp over head. Slept along a creek. I think my major mistake was putting my sleeping bag inside the bivvy. Bc around 2am I woke up with soooo much condensation lining the inside walls of the bivvy from head to toe. At 2am in the chilly woods that was not a fun discovery. FACTS: I did stay warm the whole night despite the condensation. It is tough and reusable. I did not die.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Brown

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised - keeps you warm.
customer_reviews.text: This was used a couple of weekends ago with a sleeping bag inside it. The Bivvy did well at providing the extra warmth needed. This product will trap water vapor, be warned. After using overnight, the sleep bag came out dripping wet and had to be hung up to dry. Good in a pinch, if you intend to use every night on the trail I would check out the breathable kind. I shall keep this one for emergence, my next purchase will be a breathable Bivvy.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money and space in your backpack
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly like I thought it would. I used it on a closed cell 2.25 foam mat, 20 degree sleeping bag inside the emergency bivy sack while wearing thermal undergarment wool socks and wool top. Had to make an emergency lean to shelter due to incoming storm. Temperatures were around low 20's but I was warm all night with only a little condensation on the inside the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Espasandin

customer_reviews.title: Compact.Powerful.Portablle
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with this item that I ordered a second one straight away for use in my travel bag .. as I have been stranded at airports on a number of occasions due to flight cancelations I though this would come in handy, I also keep a survival pack ready at home and plan to order 3 more so that every one in the family will have one in case of an emergency like a power outage. Order this item you will not ne diasppointed
customer_reviews.author: Thom Randle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, did the job well.I took this up with me on a fourth of July weekend backpacking trip, and I am super glad I did (the night time temp dropped below my comfort level). I had questions so I contacted the Survival Frog Team, and they have by far have the most excellent, fantastic customer service!! I definitely recommending this company to my friends and family! Their website is packed with survival gear plus free stuff! I am a happy customer :)
customer_reviews.author: Reyna Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Orange plastic bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a orange plastic bag with a silver liner.... the carrying bag was falling apart and the cord and the things to cinch it closed fell apart. Total junk. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: dober-man

customer_reviews.title: Truly compact!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully small sleeping bag, tarp, water catcher, whatever is needed! Slightly bigger than my fist and easy to carry. But allow me to remind all of you who keep putting this product down, it says emergency bivy, not reusable bivy. This will generally be a "one and done", which is fine because these products are not meant to last awhile. Therefore, treat this product as such and appreciate the light and compact design. Thanks again, I have this in my bug out bag!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dandino

customer_reviews.title: Great Product to have
customer_reviews.text: Great Product to have!! If using the bivvy instead of a sleeping bag be aware of condensation build up from ur own body heat.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Maslak

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight bivvy
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and well made. It's a nice carrying case and a typical (if not above typical) lightweight bivvy. I have no issues with the quality and it is highly recommended by folks far more experienced/knowledgeable than me. Still, I found no issues with what I received. Passed my inspection/light testing and I expect it will suffice nicely in a pinch. I did not sleep in it overnight to test it. Others I have come to trust have done so and claim it is an excellent bivvy option. I threw it in my bug out bag and hope I don't have much need for it. Might buy another or three since it is so highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Groundoggy

customer_reviews.title: Very important part of my "BUG-OUT" pack
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a small, light weight sleeping bag to put in our "Bug-out backpacks." This fits our needs perfectly, because we live in the South-West where super cold nights are rare. What is perfect with this bag is it will keep us comfortable at night, but can also be used to keep us cooler in the summer daytime heat. These bags should provide enough solar protection to avoid heat stroke in daytime temps reaching over 110 degrees. Two fold protection from the temperatures in the South-West, and I expect they will repel rain just as well. They are a major part of our bug-out kits, and I hope I never have to use them.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: This was a great edition to our 12 year olds survival pack. He is interested in wilderness survival so we created a whole kit for him for his birthday. He was able to open, try out and put it back (with a little help) for future use. He said it was super warm inside. I hope he never actually uses it, but I'm glad he has it!
customer_reviews.author: MT Mama to 6

customer_reviews.title: Just an expensive plastic bag
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this item... it is basically a colored plastic bag with a reflective interior coating -- only thing positive is the pouch is nice... DO NOT BUY... go buy a box of heavy duty hefty bags and tape them together.. that would be thicker than this appears to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R

customer_reviews.title: Just in case.
customer_reviews.text: They arrived quickly. I have not and will not open this unless I need it. I hope to never need it. I got two one for me and one for my wife both will be in the car for a “Just In Case” situation. We have family scattered around New England, New York and Illinois we like to visit. Even though we usually stay on Interstates and try avoid driving in storms, stuff can happen. Just in case we do find ourselves stuck in ditch on frozen still on a Interstate (remember Atlanta a couple of years ago?) I feel better having them stowed away with a blanket.
customer_reviews.author: RJC2u

customer_reviews.title: Tested
customer_reviews.text: I tried this bivvy in a nearby wooded area for an overnight. I hastily constructed a tarp lean-to and cleared the wet leaves under it. Added some white pine boughs and opened up the bivvy. A fire was not practical, as the land technically is private, but the bivvy held up well for a brief night. I was relatively warm inside despite the steady rain coming down. My only issue was the bright orange color. For rescue its perfect, but for stealth maybe not so much. Overall a great product I would consider purchasing several of.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: very small and light weight! :O
customer_reviews.text: while i don't mean to give you a false rating... i'm assuming the ratings on "water resistance and durability"... it would not be fair for me to give a zero rating on those, just because i don't know yet... i bought this for my brother who camps often in unreliable locations... often floods in the middle of the night, during a downpour LOL!!! however, i'm VERY impressed how tight the stitching is and how tiny and lightweight it really is... trust me, if this product fails in the 1st few nights it gets used, i'll add an update here... i hope this helps ;)
customer_reviews.author: chewifaith

customer_reviews.title: this wouldn't be a bad staple for a hiking backpack either
customer_reviews.text: i haven't used this product yet.. i bought them to go in our to go survival pack.. but i did open them up to see if they would meet our needs and was impressed with the quality and weight of the material.. and the size is exactly what we needed. i am thinking of purchasing a couple more for the car and one to drop into our camping gear just in case i need some extra warmth.. this wouldn't be a bad staple for a hiking backpack either..
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Brayden

customer_reviews.title: A Nessecity
customer_reviews.text: Living in Michigan the winters are horrible and we are known for falling off side of the road. Well that can be dangerous so I keep my TACT Survival Bag on me all the time so in case I fall off the road I can live till help comes and with it being water proof you can't beat it if you get lost it can cold water in and keep it out. To the busy city goer to the extreme survivalists I recommend this bag all the way
customer_reviews.author: DeCarlos Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have two of these.
customer_reviews.text: It is compact, light weight and very functional. I bought two and am SO glad. I keep one at home. The other gods with me everywhere in my purse. I don't have to worry. If my car breaks down or my furnace does then I can keep warm. A nice envelope to slip into which sends 90% of my body heat back to me. It is a great investment for my safety at an inexpensive price. I think I have figured out a Christmas gift for some who are hard to buy for. Don't get one, get two.😸
customer_reviews.author: Rose-Marie Ferree

customer_reviews.title: Over priced junk
customer_reviews.text: It's basically just a glorified plastic bag. Very thin and cheap material easily punctured. Don't bother if you're sleeping anywhere near rocks or twigs. You're probably better off just buying emergency blankets and wrapping yourself in them.

customer_reviews.title: Looks like good quality - and a 6-month warranty.  Suggestion: try it, to see what you think!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my GO-bag, instead of those low-quality "space blankets". (Used to be good - but, no more.) NOTE: it doesn't "breathe", so body moisture will condense inside - and you'll be WET in the morning! Using it as a sleeping bag cover, if you have to lay directly on the ground, makes more sense. This would also work great as your only cover, in an emergency - while clothed. Unrolled it, and it goes back into the stuff bag pretty easily. It stretches a bit, when pulled strongly - but, it didn't tear.
customer_reviews.author: 1audiopro

customer_reviews.title: I wanted some piece of mind in case of emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: I've considered buying a bivvy sack for years, but finally pulled the trigger on these. This was a great price, and they had good reviews. I bought three for my family. Keep in mind, these are not heavy duty sleeping bag type sacks, but they are what is advertised. I opened one up and got inside. I didn't test the temperature before and after like some have done, but could tell it would be easy to use and should do the trick. I thought it would be a pain to fold it all back and put it in the sack provided, but it wasn't at all. Well worth the price and should come in handy if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg W.

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to use this product yet but will shortly. The material seems a bit thin but seems like it will last. Having This as a back up is a must !! It’s a good size I fit in it very well with lots of room. I’m 5’10’ 195lbs and I’m very comfortable in it and it hold body heat very well.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller than I thought it would be. It fits in my C.A.P. 24 hr pack. I didn't expect that. I figured it would be in my 72 hr. I haven't attempted to use or unfold it but, it appears to be very well made. I intend to promote the product with my colleagues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tears easily. Must take great care not to damage
customer_reviews.text: Fragile, tears easily. Must take great care not to damage.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not much stronger than Saran Wrap.
customer_reviews.text: Contractor trash bags are stronger than this product by at least 15 times. It will work in an emergency to keep you from getting wet. But.........if there is even a slight breeze it will blow away. While its blowing away it will snag on something and tear. It’s the consistency of Saran Wrap. You can push your finger thru it with no effort. Small and lightweight though.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Emergency bivy sack
customer_reviews.text: This is the second I have purchased. One is in my truck, this is now in my wife’s car. Folds down small enough to fit easily into the glove box and the stuff sack keeps it manageable. I took it out and inspected it on arrival but have not used it. It appears big enough for me, 6’1” and 220 pounds. Excellent quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and easy to add to a pack but man is it ...
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to add to a pack but man is it a bear to fold back up and get in its pouch! I have to say this is a little thinner than I thought, but climbing into it I could quickly tell that it was reflecting my heat back. I don't know if I would ever use this by itself, but it is a great thing to have in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Jusitn A. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have a couple of these in there car.
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this for my son as a stocking gift. He likes to hunt. Never did I imagine he would need it so soon. Being a typical college kid he had not unpacked his trunk yet when he got back to Pittsburgh from Christmas break. He got stuck in a blizzard and had this with him. He was rescued within a few hours but I was glad he had this with him. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: I hope I never need it, but I'm glad I have it
customer_reviews.text: It's an emergency sleeping bag. If you're familiar with this type of great, it's basically like sleeping in a mylar balloon. That is, you'll stay alive but you're not going to have an awesome time sleeping. That said, the bag seems to be high quality, and the carrying bag is a nice touch. There's no way it's going back in that case this the four stars, but I'm always happy to have it when camping or hiking.
customer_reviews.author: J HowlandTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A must have when hiking, trecking or in your car in cold conditions
customer_reviews.text: Face it, we humans are fragile and can only survive in a relatively narrow temperature band. Staying warm could be the difference between life or death. This bivvy taks up almost no room at all and weighs nothing. If you are hiking, going in deep on day hunt or driving in cold conditions, you should carry one of these. I keep one in my car in case I ever get stranded or need to keep someone else warm who has been in an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah 54:17

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: This is just a mylar emergency blanket that is folded in half and glued together. I took it out of the package and started to unroll it to inspect it. Decided not to because there is noway I was going to fold it up tight enough to get back in the bag. This will live in my truck for emergencies, but it will never go camping with me. Basically a one time use item.
customer_reviews.author: George Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Its not bad
customer_reviews.text: I opened this up, not able to get it back into the little sack it came in. It hasn't ripped but seems like it might if you're too rough with it. I didn't end up using it because it was louder and somewhat inconvenient to deal with. Nothing against the seller, just not a product I found myself using after all when I went camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back and bought a used cover from eBay. I wasn't going to trust this quality on an extensive pack trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Brenner

customer_reviews.title: seems ok
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my zombie apocalypse-readiness/hiking supplies. Haven't had to use it but everything seems good. If I find that it doesn't work when the zombie apocalypse happens, I'll update my review then. Or maybe I'll go hiking sometime and will update the review then. Either way, haven't used it yet but it seems ok.
customer_reviews.author: chance

customer_reviews.title: A must have for each family member: put it ...
customer_reviews.text: A must have for each family member: put it in the glove box of your car or carry with you in an everyday carry pack. Small lightweight, you won't even notice it until you need it. If you live in the midwest, north or mountain areas - it could save your life if you get stranded. Don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Theo13

customer_reviews.title: Great product for bikepacking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who was riding the Trans Am Bike Race Across America. It saved him on a couple of stormy days. And it took up so little space! Great functional product!
customer_reviews.author: linda tanton

customer_reviews.title: Emergency blanket
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing several outlets in various publications about this survival blanket, I decided to take the jump to add these blankets to my emergency supplies. I have only given four starts due to my not having to use this product in an emergency as yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Angel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought as an emergency blanket/sleeping bag since I have a commute daily and winter weather would be less than ideal to be out in considering the negative Fahrenheit temps. Haven’t had to use this yet. But it is definitely smaller and lighter weight than I expected which is a plus
customer_reviews.author: Jillian gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: The little stuff sack is the only thing of value
customer_reviews.text: Don't trust your life to this thing... it's little more than a big trash bag... while it does reflect your body heat it doesn't breathe and soon you are soaked with sweat and now colder than before... you need something that breaths like a cheap pair of coveralls or something.
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as part of your "10 Essentials" hiking gear
customer_reviews.text: I carry one of these in each of my packs for back country emergencies. That said, I haven't had to use any of them and therefore can't attest to their quality or durability. From what I can tell though, the bivy is good for a single use and that's about it. Compared to other lightweight bivy sacks out there though, this one seems to be the best and is super light, making it perfect to have along for any type of hike.
customer_reviews.author: pomotrash

customer_reviews.title: The Jury is Out! I bought this for an emergency!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Bivy to carry with me for an emergency on a hut-to-hut ski trip in Norway. I hope never to use it. Therefore, I cannot give it an honest review at this time. It arrived when it said it would, and the outside packaging appears just as advertised. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Christine D. Bierman

customer_reviews.title: My oldest some love to hunt and camp so I got this for ...
customer_reviews.text: My oldest some love to hunt and camp so I got this for him. This is a great gift knowing that if he encounters any bad weather he has something to help weather the storms.
customer_reviews.author: neicybug

customer_reviews.title: Ultra lightweight and compact
customer_reviews.text: This item is super compact. If you have enough room in your pack to reach in and make a fist, this item will fit. It is super light weight as well. I have it tucked away between my hammock and bug screen. Because it is not breathable, I would recommend using it against the body. It will trap any moisture from perspiration or breathing and condense inside of it. This is something to keep in mind if using with another sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: It's so tiny you will loose it in your backpack
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, that is what you want from your backpacking safety equipment. Bright orange, small, lightweight, durable and you don't notice it even though you know it is in your backpack somewhere. Fortunately I have not had to use it, but the physics is straight forward. Reflect your body heat back at you to help keep you warm. Hypothermia set in? Then snuggle together with a warm buddy.
customer_reviews.author: ReliabilityEngineer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I contemplated purchasing a cheaper one. I am so glad I did not. Don't go cheap your life may depend on this product. I am amazed of how light and compact this is. It seems super durable. Love this color green, blends in very well. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: newbeginning

customer_reviews.title: Compact & ready to go!
customer_reviews.text: As an emergency item, it won't see usage until disaster strikes, so I'm hoping I'll never need to use it. That being said, I love the size & featured points of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well made, light, easy for the backpack. Bought the orange one because it's easy to see if you leave it as a marker for your campsite. Will purchase another for to keep in car. Highly recommend. Thanks TACT, and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, wears out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Did alright, but it is wearing a hole in just one use. If you're only in need for one night it's good, two nights, you might be in trouble. But then again...if you're in need for two nights you're probably in trouble already.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I like the Bivvy lightweight. The cover for it is very nice. The Bivvy is very compact. It is better quality than I expected. I would order another to keep in a mother vehicle. It’s a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CMaxDavis

customer_reviews.title: Good for emergency use
customer_reviews.text: I have other products from Survival Frog, and purchased this for my vehicle emergency bag. Not what I would go on a camping trip with, but I sometimes travel in sparsely populated areas with little to no cell service so this bag could come in really handy. It's more than a simple sleeping bag, weather resistant too.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact, nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Luckly I havent needed this... I have taken it out of the package and it is exactly what you would expect an emergency bivy to be. I was able to get it back in the bag with no issue. The carry pouch is nice looking and good quality. I always keep this in my Daypack/Emergency pack just incase. Just get it! you will not be disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Small and light
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet opened the bivy mainly because I don't think I will be able to stuff it back into it's very small sack. Therefore I do not know how water resistant or durable this is. I bought this for emergency use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies, but not for extended use.
customer_reviews.text: This bivy is pretty much a one time use, emergency space blanket. I used it on an elk hunt when we had to stay the night on the mountain. Temps were low 20’s and between this and my sleeping bag, I stayed plenty warm. Once it’s folded out, it’s impossible to compress back into the sack it comes in. I would recommend this for emergencies only. It definitely reflects heat and does the job it’s intended for. Condensation was really bad inside. So if your looking for a cheap bivy for emergencies and not repeat use, this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Products
customer_reviews.text: First time I have ordered from this company but wont be the last. They sell a quality product. Meets and exceeds my expectations. Being this is an emergency bag we haven't used yet but looking it over i am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Emergency security.
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not used this product I have read extensively about it’s features and benefits, primary I purchased two units to keep in my car for emergency use, with hurricane season upon us and winter weather soon to arrive it is a very prudent thing to do! I like the small compact size which means they will fit any where in my SUV. A must item for day hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: This is great.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than anything out there. While I haven't tested it ... except by putting my hand in it to see ... and it does appear to do what its supposed to. Getting it back into its pouch is a test but it does fit. The quality and value, like their rain suits, is outstanding. Unbeatable value, size and weight. Absolutely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: IDwanderer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I picked this as a lightweight addition to my wilderness survival kit. It takes some room in my pack- not as small as I hoped but it will keep me warm in an emergency. Hopefully I will never have to use it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Part of my day pack.
customer_reviews.text: These were put into our day packs as a survival item. A definite must have for cold or cold and wet areas. Cannot rate on waterproof or durability as I have not used it. As survival gear the idea is to have it and hope you never need it. "Better to have it and not need it than to need it and not gave it."
customer_reviews.author: TBurris

customer_reviews.title: Good for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Seems very thin and packs down to a tiny size. Clearly emergency use only so this is likely by design. It will tear easily. I was hoping for something a bit more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Anan

customer_reviews.title: lightweight sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is very compact and lightweight. It stores easily and is great for emergencies. I can hold it in my hand. Something to consider...you would definitely need more than this in a Northeast winter.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: They will keep you alive in an emergency.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in the past, twice while caught in a blizzard. They work as advertised. I have yet to open my new one as I plan to add to my wifes car. I keep two in my truck and two in my John Deere Gater. Please send a photo of you jumpimg up and down, just joking.
customer_reviews.author: Ihntnfsh

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Small. Very light weight. Actually fits back into the bag. Looks great. Have not had a real emergency yet, but I will continue field testing it (hoping a real emergency does not arise). And I even like the frog logo.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley C.

customer_reviews.title: All Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my go bag ... so can’t give review on quality, and hope I never have to... with that said, it looks like great quality and very compact .... if this does everything it is said to do, would be great for our homeless.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdawg

customer_reviews.title: Emergency protection.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bivvy for my son, for his birthday. I bought one sometime ago for myself for survival reasons when I go on a hike or overnight camping in case it gets cold or rainy.My son lives in Utah, where it is colder, and needs one for when he goes camping,whereas I live in Las Vegas where it's much warmer,but Mt' Charleston is where I go to hike or camp.Mt. Charleston is only 40 miles from Las Vegas,but the temperature difference can be drastic.Thanks for such great products.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W Bunker

customer_reviews.title: Bivvy, really?
customer_reviews.text: I expected something a little thicker and a little more durable if you get a entire night out of this without it tearing apart I would be impressed sorry I wanted to like it, the bag is nice.
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Impressively compact
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it, and hope not to because it is for emergencies, but I was skeptical about whether it was really compact. It legit does fit in a glovebox. You could smuggle this thing over a border if you had to, and I don't mean on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Krishna

customer_reviews.title: This thing is small
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it so if it turns out to be no good I’ll double back and update this review- it’s super tiny- was surprised how smal it is- perfect for a bug out bag
customer_reviews.author: A. Landry

customer_reviews.title: I like what I see and the small size and weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put in two survival kits. I knew it would be small and light weight, but it exceeds my expectations on both counts. We may never need to use these, but I'm glad I have them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gately

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact!  Fits in a standard coffee mug!
customer_reviews.text: Since this is a piece of emergency gear, AND reportedly a genie that's hard to get back in the bottle (well, stuff sack), I haven't used it, and don't plan to until I need it. That said, the sucker is way more compact than I expected, and if it provides any measure of emergency protection, it's well worth the weight and bulk. It's a clear upgrade from the discount-store Mylar emergency bag it replaced in my "hiking misc." pouch. By that standard alone, it's worth 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Halbarad

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my bag
